text: Loktak Lake () is the largest freshwater lake in India, located in the central plains of the state of Manipur. It is famous for the phumdis (or floating islands) that float on it, of which the largest forms the Keibul Lamjao National Park, the only floating national park in the world. It is also known as the "world's only floating lake" and is a tourist attraction in Northeast India. ==Related pages== * Floating island * Karang Island * Loktak Folklore Museum == References == Category:Lakes of India Category:Manipur
title: Loktak Lake
